register.description: The Revision Register contains the major and minor revisions for the module.

bitfield.description: Module ID field
RTL revision. Will vary depending on release.
Major revision
Minor revision

register.description: The performance control register contains fields which can be used to adjust the performance of the BCDMA in the system.

bitfield.description: This feature is not currently supported.

register.description: The emulation control register is used to control the behavior of the DMA when the emususp input is asserted.
The PSI-L proxy timeout register controls the timeout watchdog and reports timeout occurrances on PSI-L configuration transactions issued by the built in PSI-L proxy.

bitfield.description: Timeout occurred. When set indicates that a timeout has occurred on a config access
Timeout period. Specifies how many cycles to wait before closing up a conifiguration read or write transaction and asserting the tout bit

register.description: The Capabilities Register 0 specifies which standard features this BCDMA instance supports.

bitfield.description: Global triggers 0 and 1 are supported
Dedicated local trigger is supported
EOL field is supported
STATIC field is supported
Type 15 TR is supported
Type 14 TR is supported
Type 13 TR is supported
Type 12 TR is supported
Type 11 TR is supported
Type 10 TR is supported
Type 9 TR is supported
Type 8 TR is supported
Type 7 TR is supported
Type 6 TR is supported
Type 5 TR is supported
Type 4 TR is supported
Type 3 TR is supported
Type 2 TR is supported
Type 1 TR is supported
Type 0 TR is supported

register.description: The Capabilities Register 1 specifies which standard features this BCDMA instance supports.

bitfield.description: Maximum second TR function that is supported
Maximum data reformatting function that is supported
Maximum element type value that is supported.
The maximum AMODE that is supported. If AMODE is supported then DIR field must be supported for that AMODE.

register.description: The Capabilities Register 2 specifies how many resources this BCDMA instance supports.

bitfield.description: Rx split channel count
Tx split channel count
BC channel count

register.description: The Capabilities Register 3 specifies how many resources this BCDMA instance supports.

bitfield.description: BC ultra high capacity internal channel count
BC high capacity internal channel count

register.description: The Capabilities Register 4 specifies how many resources this BCDMA instance supports.

bitfield.description: TX ultra high capacity internal channel count
TX high capacity internal channel count
RX ultra high capacity internal channel count
RX high capacity internal channel count

register.description: This register provides a writable address which allows debug information to be read from the Debug Data Register

bitfield.description: Debug enable
Selects which unit to read debug information from
Selects offset within unit to access seperate debug registers

register.description: This register provides read only debug data

bitfield.description: Provides debug information from various internal units. The value which is read back depends on which unit and register are selected in the Debug Address Register
